title: StartisBack+ 1.0 -=[HajrullaH]=-
description:
Windows 8.1 upgrade

Do I still need StartIsBack as Windows 8.1 has its own Start button?

Yes. The Windows 8.1 still does not have a proper Start menu.

Will StartIsBack work on Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2?

Yes! New version of StartIsBack, called StartIsBack+, is available for Windows 8.1.

I have Windows 8 and StartIsBack. How do I upgrade to Windows 8.1?

Before upgrading to Windows 8.1, ensure you have StartIsBack version 2.0 or above. If you have earlier version you must update StartIsBack.
Once you upgrade Windows 8 to Windows 8.1 you must install StartIsBack+. You don't have to uninstall StartIsBack; your settings and license will be kept.

Will I need to buy new key for the program on Windows 8.1?

No! Your license key will work for both StartIsBack and StartIsBack+.
Features

How do I configure Start Menu?

Either right-click Start button and click "Properties" or right-click opened Start Menu itself and choose "Properties" context menu item.

How do I invoke new Windows 8 Start Screen?

Either press Ctrl+Win (configurable shortcut) or click Start button with mouse wheel. If mouse wheel click is not working, you may need to tweak your mouse driver.

If I turn my Start Screen into Apps Screen, will I be able to undo it?

Yes. You can disable this feature at any moment and your desktop shortcuts will return to their places.

How do I rearrange programs in All Programs list?

You can rearrange folders and programs in All Programs list, both in Windows 7 and Windows XP mode, if you uncheck "Sort All Programs menu by name" option.

Can I integrate StartIsBack into my Windows installation?

Yes; the easiest way would be to create image of installation with StartIsBack installed, with tool like RecImg. Download Deployment Guide to find more.

How do I uninstall StartIsBack?

As expected: go to Control Panel - Programs and Features, find StartIsBack and click Uninstall.
